questions.text: Consider an IP datagram of size 1400 bytes (including IP header) being transmitted over a network with an MTU of 620 bytes. The IP header is 20 bytes. Which of the following statements are TRUE regarding the fragmentation of this datagram?
options: The datagram will be fragmented into exactly three fragments.
The MF (More Fragments) flag will be set in the first two fragments and cleared in the last fragment.
The fragment offset values for the fragments will be 0, 75, and 150 respectively.
All fragments will have the same Identification field value.

questions.text: In a slotted ALOHA network with a total channel capacity of 2 Mbps, each station transmits frames of size 1000 bits. If the probability of a station transmitting in a slot is 0.2 and the expected number of successful transmissions per second is 300, what is the maximum number of stations that can be supported in this network?
Which of the following best describes the primary purpose of switching delay in a network switch?
right: The time taken to process and forward a frame from input port to output port.
Reducing interference between signals in the network.
Converting digital signals to analog signals.
